title: Plastic surgeon suggests Piers Morgan sorts 'dropping eyelids'
text:
Piers Morgan was left seething over feedback about his features (Picture: ITV)

Piers Morgan has been recommended some cosmetic surgery on his ‘soft chin’ and ‘dropping eyelids’.

Cosmetic surgeon Dr Julian de Silva analysed the faces of Piers and his Good Morning Britain co-host Susanna Reid and pointed out their highlights and flaws.

While he feels Piers was ‘quite handsome as a young man’, he criticised other areas that have come on with age.

The surgeon had mapped Piers and Susanna’s faces based on the ‘golden ratio’ of beauty, originally created by the ancient Greeks using maths, and gave his thoughts on their looks and bone structure.

He said: ‘Piers has strong features an a particularly well shaped nose, which is quite remarkable for a man. You can tell from the main structure of his face that he must have been quite handsome as young man.

‘What lowers his score somewhat is the softening of the jawline and around the neck and chin which is quite common in a man of his age, and also some slightly dropping of the eyelids above the eye, but all these things can be greatly improved with cosmetic surgery procedures.’

‘Plastic surgeon wants more work shocker,’ the presenter quipped.

Piers was ‘quite handsome as a young man’, according to De Silva (Picture: ITV)

Susanna was declared ‘extremely beautiful’ (Picture: ITV)

However the doctor was full of praise for Susanna, calling her ‘an extremely beautiful woman’.

De Silva went on: ‘Her nose is in wonderful proportion to her lips. In fact all of her mapping scores were in the 80s or above which shows a high degree of symmetry and it’s clear she is an extremely beautiful woman.’

Of course Piers was grouchy about the feedback his co-presenter received, saying: ‘Where are the negatives? No negatives. Absolutely ridiculous. I used to be alright once and now you’re a fat lad. She gets, oh radiant, beautiful, wonderful.’

De Silva was the man who declared model Bella Hadid the most beautiful woman in the world based on the ‘golden ratio’.

Good Morning Britain airs weekdays from 6am on ITV.
